Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2009 05:08PM KatieT wrote: My surgeon said she takes a golf ball size sample of tissue.  I had only ADH, though, and no LCIS. As far as I know, the biopsy determines cancer, not the naked eye.
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy question covertanjou covertanjou

Posts.Content: KatieT wrote: Stereotactic biospy came back ADH; excisional biopsy was last Thursday. What do you think of getting a 2nd path opinion regardless of what the 1st one says? Given the lack of agreement about ADH and DCIS, even if the 1st one comes back ADH, I'll wonder if they missed something or had lower standards.  With Hopkins so close, it seems like a no brainer to let them have a 2nd look. (esp since my insurance will cover it!) Too much worry?  Is ADH after an excisional usually right?  As far as a second opinion, I'd also be looking for confirmation, not just a different opinion.  If 2 reports give me the same answer, I'd be much more at ease. Thanks ladies! Your posts here are so helpful :-) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 2nd Opinion Question KatieT KatieT

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2009 01:48PM KatieT wrote: Thanks for the quick replies.  John's Hopkins is less than 30 min away and if insurance covers it, I may as well!
Posts.Title: 2nd Opinion Question KatieT KatieT

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2009 08:40AM KatieT wrote: I had a stereotactic in early March.  Whatever procedure you have, there is some risk; there's no getting away from that.  Personally, I prefer least invasive first. Go with your gut, but do get it checked out.
